books.title: A COURT OF MIST AND FURY

books.author: Amy Tintera
books.description: A true crime podcast focusing on the unsolved murder of her friend forces Lucy to return to where it happened. Read by Will Damron and January LaVoy. 9 hours, 18 minutes unabridged.
books.title: LISTEN FOR THE LIE

books.author: Freida McFadden
books.description: A math teacher at Caseham High suspects there is more going on behind a scandal involving a teacher and a student. Read by Leslie Howard and Danny Montooth. 9 hours, 35 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE TEACHER

books.author: David Baldacci
books.description: Lawyers from different backgrounds represent a Black man charged with killing a wealthy white couple in Virginia in 1968. Read by MacLeod Andrews, Sisi Aisha Johnson, Kiiri Sandy, Cary Hite and the author. 14 hours, 28 minutes unabridged.
books.title: A CALAMITY OF SOULS

books.author: Abraham Verghese
books.description: Three generations of a family living on South India’s Malabar Coast suffer the loss of a family member by drowning. Read by the author. 31 hours, 16 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE COVENANT OF WATER

books.author: Jonathan Haidt
books.description: A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children. Read by Sean Pratt and the author. 10 hours, 33 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE ANXIOUS GENERATION

books.author: Jennette McCurdy
books.description: The actress and filmmaker describes her eating disorders and difficult relationship with her mother. Read by the author. 6 hours, 25 minutes unabridged.
books.title: I'M GLAD MY MOM DIED

books.author: Annie Jacobsen
books.description: The author of “Operation Paperclip” portrays possible outcomes in the minutes following a nuclear missile launch. Read by the author. 11 hours, 20 minutes unabridged.
books.title: NUCLEAR WAR

books.author: Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.contributor: by Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.description: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity. Read by Peter Attia. 17 hours, 8 minutes unabridged.
books.title: OUTLIVE

books.author: Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over 35 years. Read by the author. 6 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery. Read by Sean Pratt. 16 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: Rebel Wilson
books.description: The comedic actress shares impactful experiences from her childhood in Australia to more recent obstacles in life. Read by the author. 10 hours, 48 minutes unabridged.
books.title: REBEL RISING

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.description: Applying the principles of Navy SEALs leadership training to any organization. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.author: Fareed Zakaria
books.description: The CNN host draws out lessons for the present polarized era from the 17th-century Netherlands, the French Revolution and the Industrial Revolution. Read by the author. 13 hours, 2 minutes unabridged.
books.title: AGE OF REVOLUTIONS

books.author: Doris Kearns Goodwin
books.description: A trove of items collected by the Pulitzer Prize-winning historian’s late husband inspired an appraisal of central figures and pivotal moments of the 1960s. Read by Bryan Cranston and the author. 17 hours, 38 minutes unabridged.
books.title: AN UNFINISHED LOVE STORY

books.author: Walter Isaacson
books.description: The author of “The Code Breaker” traces Musk’s life and summarizes his work on electric vehicles, private space exploration and artificial intelligence. Read by Jeremy Bobb. 20 hours, 27 minutes unabridged.
books.title: ELON MUSK

books.author: Patric Gagne
books.description: Gagne, who was diagnosed as a sociopath when she was in college, reconnects with someone from her past who helps her chart her future. Read by the author. 11 hours, 6 minutes unabridged.
books.title: SOCIOPATH

books.author: Abigail Shrier
books.description: Shrier makes her case that the mental health industry has a negative impact on American children. Read by the author. 8 hours, 57 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BAD THERAPY

books.author: Britney Spears
books.description: The Grammy Award-winning pop star details her personal and professional experiences, including the years she spent under a conservatorship overseen by her father. Read by Michelle Williams. 5 hours, 31 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE WOMAN IN ME

books.author: Matthew Perry
books.description: The late actor, known for playing Chandler Bing on “Friends,” shares stories from his childhood and his struggles with sobriety. Read by the author. 8 hours, 49 minutes unabridged.
books.title: FRIENDS, LOVERS, AND THE BIG TERRIBLE THING
